parts.text: Okay, unfortunately our most recent run was interrupted by another extension reloading VS Code. However there are some result files available for analysis. We will need to rerun the vector_stack process using the experiment orchestrator again. Note that Liblinear and SVM both failed to converge again and they took an immense amount of time to do so. Liblinear I think was over an hour and SVM had not fully converged when it was closed after two hours. So we need to investigate these things a bit more. i.e improve performance in terms of convergence and speed. This may be a deeper issue with sparseness of the homology data. Let's get ourselves back up to speed with what happened in this run first.

message.text: Okay, unfortunately our most recent run was interrupted by another extension reloading VS Code. However there are some result files available for analysis. We will need to rerun the vector_stack process using the experiment orchestrator again. Note that Liblinear and SVM both failed to converge again and they took an immense amount of time to do so. Liblinear I think was over an hour and SVM had not fully converged when it was closed after two hours. So we need to investigate these things a bit more. i.e improve performance in terms of convergence and speed. This may be a deeper issue with sparseness of the homology data. Let's get ourselves back up to speed with what happened in this run first.

response.value: Gathering code context for vector stack orchestration, solver settings, and last run log to accurately summarize the interrupted run and diagnose convergence issues.
Reading vector_stack module and extraction script to understand feature sparsity and solver configuration.
Searching for experiment orchestrator and solver configuration related to logistic regression, linear SVM, liblinear.
Reading orchestrator script to understand pipeline and classifier settings.
Searching extract_vector_stack script for classifier implementations and solver settings.
Listing validation directory to locate extract_vector_stack.py.

Recapping the interrupted run and setting up a focused plan to diagnose + fix LR/SVM convergence issues.

## Checklist
- Summarize current metrics artifacts
- Identify anomalies (confusion matrices, class balance hints)
- Compute / recall expected feature dimensionality & sparsity factors
- Diagnose likely root causes of very slow / nonconvergence
- Recommend concrete diagnostics to add for next rerun
- Propose faster rerun parameter set (without sacrificing evaluation integrity)
- Outline deeper remediation paths (if sparsity / class imbalance confirmed)

## 1. What we have (metrics_with_flags.json excerpt)
Models (all marked nondegradation):
- Logistic Regression: PR-AUC 0.7763, ROC-AUC 0.6476, best F1 0.8316
- Linear SVM: PR-AUC 0.7936, ROC-AUC 0.6931, best F1 0.8611
- Gradient Boosted Trees: PR-AUC 0.8056, ROC-AUC 0.6729, best F1 0.8419 (feature importances saved)

Anomaly: Confusion matrices serialized as something like [[934], []] instead of a normal 22 (same for others). That strongly suggests one of:
1. Only one class present in y_test (scikit returns 11 matrix) and our serialization logic inadvertently appended an empty second row somewhere upstream, or
2. Data corruption / partial write during interruption.

If y_test truly had a single class, ROC-AUC should raise an exceptionso more likely the file got truncated mid-write or the confusion matrix object got mutated (less likely). We need to re-derive confusion matrices on rerun to confirm.

## 2. Expected vector stack feature dimensionality
Per homology dimension (H0, H1):
- Landscapes: levels=3, resolutions=(100,300)  3*(100+300)=1200
- Persistence Images: (1616 + 3232)=256+1024=1280
- Betti curve: 300
- SW projections: angles=48 (or 32 earlier), resolution=300  48*300=14,400
- Kernel small/large: 32 + 32 = 64
Subtotal per dim  17,244; for two dims  34,488 dense features.

This size is moderate, but:
- Many blocks (landscapes/images/betti) contain large low-variance or near-zero regions.
- SW projection block dominates ( 83% of features), potentially poorly scaled despite per-block z-score (because internal distributions can be very flat).

## 3. Likely causes of very slow convergence
1. Calibration multiplies cost: CalibratedClassifierCV with 3-fold CV trains logistic regression (and SVM) 3 extra times each. With max_iter=8000 and possible early plateaus, this alone can push runtime >1h if solver struggles.
2. L1 penalty (lr_penalty=l1) with saga on moderately high-dimensional, low-signal blocks tends to produce many near-zero coefficient updates  slow shrinkage, especially with tolerance 1e-3 if gradients are tiny.
3. Class imbalance: If attack rate is low, class_weight='balanced' inflates minority gradients; if combined with only a handful of positive samples per fold, variance increases iteration counts.
4. LinearSVC default dual=True may be suboptimal depending on n_samples vs n_features (if n_samples >> n_features, dual=False is faster; if n_features >> n_samples, dual=True is okbut we need counts).
5. Potential quasi-collinearity: SW + images + landscapes can yield highly correlated columns making optimization slower.
6. No feature pruning of constant / near-constant columns (e.g., empty landscapes for sparse diagrams) wastes cycles.
7. Interrupted run may have been in calibration phase (worst-case repeated fits).

## 4. Immediate diagnostics to add before next run
(We should instrument

in next step.)
Capture and persist:
- n_samples_train, n_samples_test, class counts (both classes) and attack_rate.
- Per-model training wall time and (for LR) n_iter_ (from estimator or from each CV fold).
- Convergence flags: whether n_iter_ hit max_iter (store boolean).
- SVM dual/primal selection and n_iter_ (LinearSVC exposes n_iter_ as an array).
- Count of zero-variance features after normalization (fast: (X_train.std(axis=0)==0).sum()).
- Mean / median absolute coefficient magnitude after LR fit (sanity of shrinkage).
- Optional: For each block span, fraction of zero entries across train set (sparsity profile).

## 5. Fast rerun parameter adjustments (exploratory)
Primary goal: Obtain clean metrics + convergence telemetry fast, not final peak performance.

Suggested run (tier 1):
- Disable calibration temporarily (--no-calibration) to remove 3 overhead.
- Logistic Regression: switch penalty to l2 for speed OR keep l1 but relax max_iter and increase tol.
  - Option A (speed baseline): penalty=l2, max_iter=2000, tol=5e-3
  - Option B (retain sparsity): penalty=l1, max_iter=4000, tol=2e-3
- Reduce SW angles from 48 -> 32 for this diagnostic pass (if orchestrator allows via --sw-angles 32) to drop ~4800 features (~14% reduction).
- Linear SVM: add logic to set dual = (n_samples < n_features). If n_samples >> n_features, set dual=False. Raise tol to 1e-3 (default) or 2e-3.
- (Optionally) Skip ablations (--skip-ablations) until convergence instrumentation verified.
- Keep gradient boosted trees unchanged (serves as performance anchor).

Tier 2 (after instrumentation):
- Implement zero-variance (or near-zero variance) feature pruning prior to fitting LR/SVM (simple mask). Persist mask for test transform.
- Consider elasticnet (l1_ratio=0.3) with saga for balanced sparsity/performance.
- If still slow, replace LinearSVC with SGDClassifier(loss='hinge', penalty='l2', class_weight='balanced', early_stopping=True) for a stochastic baseline.

## 6. Root cause hypotheses to validate
| Hypothesis | Evidence Needed | Action if True |
|------------|-----------------|----------------|
| Single-class test split (bad split) | Recompute class counts | Fix manifest splitting logic |
| Extreme imbalance | Attack rate metrics | Threshold tuning / reweighting stable |
| Overly strict solver settings | n_iter_ == max_iter | Relax tol, reduce features |
| Redundant high-correlation blocks | Block-level variance & correlation sample | Potential dimensionality reduction (PCA on SW curves only) |
| Many constant / zero columns | Zero-variance count | Prune before fit |

## 7. Proposed next concrete steps
1. Add instrumentation (as above) to extract script (and optionally orchestrator) before rerun.
2. Rerun orchestrator with fast diagnostic parameter set:  
   python

--sw-angles 32 --lr-penalty l2 --lr-max-iter 2000 --svm-max-iter 4000 --baseline-pr 0.706 --no-calibration --skip-ablations
3. Review new metrics + convergence telemetry.
4. Decide whether to (a) re-enable calibration and (b) restore angles after confirming stability.

(If you want, I can implement the instrumentation patch next.)

## 8. Deeper remediation (only after confirming diagnostics)
- Block-wise adaptive pruning: Remove blocks whose normalized mean absolute value < tiny threshold across train (likely empty signal).
- SW downsampling: Use fewer angles + smaller resolution (e.g., 24 angles  200) if minimal PR-AUC impact.
- Replace dense float arrays with sparse COO for predominantly zero blocks (if measured sparsity >70%) and use solvers supporting sparse input (saga does).
- Lightweight dimensionality reduction (TruncatedSVD) on SW portion only, retaining 95% variance, then concatenate other blocks.

## 9. Quick interpretation of current metrics quality
PR-AUC ~0.780.81 across models already clears baseline 0.706 (no degradation). So performance is acceptable; bottleneck is training efficiency & reliability, not accuracy regression.

## 10. Recommendation
Proceed with instrumentation + fast rerun before changing core feature construction. Avoid premature structural pruning until we have empirical sparsity / variance stats.

Let me know and I can immediately apply the instrumentation edits and trigger the new run. Would you like me to implement the patch now?

  - Option A (speed baseline): penalty=l2, max_iter=2000, tol=5e-3

This plan leverages cutting-edge techniques from graph neural networks, attention mechanisms, and high-dimensional embeddings while preserving the stable foundation of the current vector_stack implementation.
- Deterministic multi-block vector stack in `src.embeddings.vector_stack` (if using stacked topological liftings)
Validation scripts must reference `validation/extract_vector_stack.py` (or timestamped variant) for reproducibility.

1. Implement vector_stack module with deterministic functions (no training
"""Deterministic vector stack feature construction for persistence diagrams.
Implements multiple stable topological liftings combined into a single
feature vector per sample (window). Only genuine topological transforms
are used. No statistical proxy features (means, std, etc.).
5. Static Kernel Dictionary Responses (multi-scale Gaussian dictionaries)
Silhouettes intentionally deferred for initial evaluation.
All computations are dimension-wise (H0, H1) and concatenated in a fixed
block order recorded in the manifest for reproducibility & ablation.

# For each grid point compute triangle heights, then take kth largest per level

# Now for each level k take kth order statistic across points at each grid location
# Sort descending along axis 0 per column (points) - use partial sort for efficiency if needed
# Simpler: we gather non-zero contributions per column
def _adaptive_sigma(birth_life: np.ndarray, clamp_min: float, clamp_max: float) -> float:
def _compute_persistence_images(dgm: np.ndarray, grids: Sequence[Tuple[int, int]], cfg: VectorStackConfig,
birth_range: Tuple[float, float], life_range: Tuple[float, float]) -> Dict[str, np.ndarray]:
# Evaluate contribution on grid (vectorized per point)
# Sweep-line style: for each point add interval
# Golden angle sequence for deterministic coverage
def _compute_sliced_wasserstein(dgm: np.ndarray, num_angles: int, resolution: int) -> Dict[str, np.ndarray]:
proj = pts @ np.array([[c, 0.0], [0.0, s]])  # birth*c, death*s
# collapse to 1D signature: project births and deaths separately then combine by sorting
# Map v range to grid range
# dists shape (n,k); ignore self-distance at col0
_log(f"Sampling up to {sample_n} points for '{scale_name}' scale", cfg)
_log(f"No points available for '{scale_name}', creating zero centers", cfg)
probs = d2 / d2.sum() if d2.sum() > 0 else np.ones_like(d2) / d2.size
np.savez_compressed(out_path, **{k: v['centers'] for k, v in dicts.items()})
json.dump({k: {'sigma_base': v['sigma_base']} for k, v in dicts.items()}, f, indent=2)
def _kernel_responses(dgm: np.ndarray, centers: np.ndarray, sigma: float, max_points: int) -> np.ndarray:
# Average pooling for scale invariance w.r.t number of points
def compute_block_features(diagrams_by_dim: Dict[int, np.ndarray], cfg: VectorStackConfig,
kernel_dicts: Dict[str, Any]) -> Tuple[Dict[str, np.ndarray], Dict[str, Tuple[int, int]]]:
finite = dgm[np.isfinite(dgm[:, 1])] if dgm.size > 0 else dgm
_log("Silhouette block requested but not yet implemented; skipping (placeholder)", cfg)
def stack_and_normalize(blocks: Dict[str, np.ndarray], spans: Dict[str, Tuple[int, int]],
fit: bool = False, cfg: Optional[VectorStackConfig] = None) -> Tuple[np.ndarray, Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]]:
# Compute / apply per-block z-score using train-only stats
updated_stats: Dict[str, Dict[str, float]] = {} if fit else (norm_stats or {})
_log(f"Fit norm stats for {key}: mean={mean:.4e} std={std:.4e}", cfg)
flat = np.concatenate(vector_parts) if vector_parts else np.zeros(0, dtype=float)
def build_vector_stack(diagrams_by_dim: Dict[int, np.ndarray], cfg: VectorStackConfig,
kernel_dicts: Dict[str, Any], norm_stats: Optional[Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]] = None,
fit_norm: bool = False) -> Tuple[np.ndarray, Dict[str, Dict[str, float]], Dict[str, Tuple[int, int]]]:
vec, stats = stack_and_normalize(blocks, spans, norm_stats, fit=fit_norm, cfg=cfg)

print('[orchestrator] Could not locate new vector_stack_outputs directory; aborting artifact harvest.')
"""Unified experiment orchestration for deterministic vector stack TDA experiments.
6. Ablation scheduling passthrough (uses underlying extract script)
7. Sparse feature pruner (optional secondary pass with L1 LR)
9. Multi-run aggregator (delegates to extract script already; additional summarization)
14. Automatic Codacy scan hook (touch marker file to signal external process; real scan triggered by agent rules)
15. Change impact diff (against last successful vector stack run)
17. Data drift monitor (timestamps + label balance only  no statistical proxies)
19. Auto cleanup policy (prune old non-top runs)
20. Silhouette block toggle scaffold (placeholder flag audit)
NOTE: Heavy computations (full feature extraction) delegated to validation/extract_vector_stack.py
This script is intentionally lightweight and compliant with UNIFIED_AGENT_INSTRUCTIONS.
from typing import Dict, Any, List, Optional
for chunk in iter(lambda: f.read(8192), b''):
# Ensure only allowed blocks & no forbidden statistical proxy flags
forbidden_keys = [k for k in config.keys() if 'mean' in k.lower() or 'std' in k.lower()]
# Mandatory block ordering presence is implied via extract script; basic sanity
# Non-fatal; we will mark but not block; script will supply defaults
def classify_run(pr_auc: float, baseline: float) -> str:
rel_drop = abs(diff) / baseline if baseline > 0 else 1.0
def optimize_threshold(metrics_json: Dict[str, Any], recall_target: float = 0.85):
# We rely on best_threshold already saved; placeholder for constraint variant
# If best threshold recall < target, we keep best; real implementation would search stored prob arrays
for run_id, meta in sorted(registry.items(), key=lambda x: x[1].get('timestamp','')):
def compute_diff(previous_path: Optional[Path], current_hash: str) -> str:
# For simplicity store last vector_stack.py hash; real diff already in VCS.
added = sum(1 for l in curr if l not in prev)
removed = sum(1 for l in prev if l not in curr)
return f"Added lines (naive count): {added}, Removed lines (naive count): {removed}, current_hash={current_hash}"
# Placeholder: would load coefficients if persisted. Return stub.
import numpy as np  # local import
runs = sorted([p for p in RUN_BASE.iterdir() if p.is_dir()], key=lambda p: p.name)
# Keep newest keep_success successes + all failures
# Skip if hash & config already in registry
if not args.force and snapshot_id in registry:

"""Extraction & evaluation script for deterministic vector stack features.
1. Load diagram manifests (assumed precomputed & temporally split already) OR compute diagrams if absent.
2. Fit kernel dictionaries on TRAIN diagrams only (H0,H1) respecting temporal boundary.
3. Construct vector stack features for train & test sets (fit normalization on train only).
4. Train baseline classifiers: Logistic Regression, Linear SVM, Gradient Boosted Trees.
5. Calibrate LR probabilities (isotonic or Platt depending on validation size) using train set CV.
6. Evaluate on test set; compute PR-AUC, ROC-AUC, confusion matrix at default threshold (0.5) and best F1 threshold.
7. Save artifacts: feature matrices, normalization stats, kernel dicts, metrics JSON, block manifest spans.
NOTE: This script relies ONLY on topological transformations; no statistical proxies.
from typing import Dict, List, Tuple, Any
from sklearn.metrics import precision_recall_curve, average_precision_score, roc_auc_score, confusion_matrix, classification_report, brier_score_loss

"""Auto-detect train/test manifests or create from unified manifest."""

latest_manifest, diagram_dir = max(unified_manifests, key=lambda x: x[0].stat().st_mtime)
# Create train/test manifests using bridge script
# Update diagram paths to point to correct directory

vec, norm_stats, spans = build_vector_stack(dgm_dict, cfg, kernel_dicts, norm_stats=norm_stats, fit_norm=(norm_stats is None))
vec, _, _ = build_vector_stack(dgm_dict, cfg, kernel_dicts, norm_stats=norm_stats, fit_norm=False)
return np.vstack(X_train), np.array(y_train), np.vstack(X_test), np.array(y_test), norm_stats, spans_ref, kernel_dicts
for rec in sorted(entries, key=lambda r: r['diagram_path']):

# Gradient Boosted Trees (unchanged params for now)
def _evaluate_probs(probs: np.ndarray, y_true: np.ndarray) -> Dict[str, Any]:

from sklearn.metrics import precision_score, recall_score, f1_score
for i, v in enumerate([prec, rec, f1]):
parser.add_argument('--sw-angles', type=int, default=48, help='Number of sliced Wasserstein angles (was 32)')
parser.add_argument('--lr-max-iter', type=int, default=8000, help='Logistic regression max_iter (was 2000)')

if 'gradient_boosted_trees' in results and 'feature_importances' in results['gradient_boosted_trees']:
ablation_results = run_ablation(X_train, y_train, X_test, y_test, cfg, norm_stats, kernel_dicts, spans,

edits.text:
#!/usr/bin/env python3 """Unified experiment orchestration for deterministic vector stack TDA experiments. Implements automation items 120 (initial functional version): 1. Experiment orchestrator (this script) 2. Config snapshot & hashing 3. Topology integrity validator (lightweight) 4. Baseline gate (PR-AUC comparison) 5. Failure classifier & logging 6. Ablation scheduling passthrough (uses underlying extract script) 7. Sparse feature pruner (optional secondary pass with L1 LR) 8. Threshold optimization (constraint recall >= target) 9. Multi-run aggregator (delegates to extract script already; additional summarization) 10. Artifact completeness checker 11. Repro script generator 12. GPU capability probe 13. Metric trend dashboard (HTML stub generation) 14. Automatic Codacy scan hook (touch marker file to signal external process; real scan triggered by agent rules) 15. Change impact diff (against last successful vector stack run) 16. Experiment registry index 17. Data drift monitor (timestamps + label balance only no statistical proxies) 18. Time/resource logging (wall & peak RSS) 19. Auto cleanup policy (prune old non-top runs) 20. Silhouette block toggle scaffold (placeholder flag audit) NOTE: Heavy computations (full feature extraction) delegated to validation/extract_vector_stack.py This script is intentionally lightweight and compliant with UNIFIED_AGENT_INSTRUCTIONS. """ from __future__ import annotations import argparse import hashlib import json import os import shutil import subprocess import sys import textwrap import time from datetime import datetime from pathlib import Path from typing import Dict, Any, List, Optional import glob ROOT = Path(__file__).resolve().parents[1] VALIDATION_DIR = ROOT / 'validation' EXTRACT_SCRIPT = VALIDATION_DIR / 'extract_vector_stack.py' REGISTRY_PATH = VALIDATION_DIR / 'experiment_registry.json' VECTOR_STACK_PATH = ROOT / 'src' / 'embeddings' / 'vector_stack' / 'vector_stack.py' RUN_BASE = VALIDATION_DIR / 'vector_stack_experiments' DASHBOARD_HTML = VALIDATION_DIR / 'vector_stack_dashboard.html' REQUIRED_ARTIFACTS = [ 'results/metrics.json', 'results/metrics_with_flags.json', 'results/mandatory_metrics.json', 'plots/precision_recall_curve.png', 'plots/roc_curve.png', 'plots/reliability_curve.png', 'plots/confusion_matrix.png', 'raw_output/classification_report.txt', ] FAILURE_LOG = VALIDATION_DIR / 'FAILURE_LOG.md' # ----------------------------- Helpers ----------------------------- # def sha256_file(path: Path) -> str: h = hashlib.sha256() with open(path, 'rb') as f: for chunk in iter(lambda: f.read(8192), b''): h.update(chunk) return h.hexdigest() def load_json(path: Path, default=None): if path.exists(): with open(path, 'r') as f: return json.load(f) return default def save_json(path: Path, obj: Any): path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) with open(path, 'w') as f: json.dump(obj, f, indent=2) # ----------------------------- Topology Integrity Validator ----------------------------- # def validate_topology_integrity(config: Dict[str, Any]): # Ensure only allowed blocks & no forbidden statistical proxy flags forbidden_keys = [k for k in config.keys() if 'mean' in k.lower() or 'std' in k.lower()] if forbidden_keys: raise ValueError(f"Forbidden statistical-like keys present: {forbidden_keys}") # Mandatory block ordering presence is implied via extract script; basic sanity for flag in ['enable_landscapes','enable_images','enable_betti','enable_sw','enable_kernels']: if flag not in config: # Non-fatal; we will mark but not block; script will supply defaults config.setdefault(flag, True) return True # ----------------------------- Registry Handling ----------------------------- # def load_registry() -> Dict[str, Any]: return load_json(REGISTRY_PATH, default={}) or {} def update_registry(registry: Dict[str, Any]): save_json(REGISTRY_PATH, registry) # ----------------------------- Baseline & Failure Classification ----------------------------- # def classify_run(pr_auc: float, baseline: float) -> str: diff = pr_auc - baseline if diff >= 0: # improvement or match return 'SUCCESS' rel_drop = abs(diff) / baseline if baseline > 0 else 1.0 if rel_drop > 0.10: return 'FAILURE' if rel_drop > 0.05: return 'WARNING' return 'REGRESSION' # ----------------------------- Artifact Completeness ----------------------------- # def check_artifacts(run_dir: Path) -> List[str]: missing = [] for rel in REQUIRED_ARTIFACTS: if not (run_dir / rel).exists(): missing.append(rel) return missing # ----------------------------- GPU Probe ----------------------------- # def gpu_probe() -> Dict[str, Any]: info = {'available': False} try: import torch # type: ignore info['available'] = torch.cuda.is_available() if info['available']: idx = torch.cuda.current_device() info['device_name'] = torch.cuda.get_device_name(idx) info['total_mem_gb'] = round(torch.cuda.get_device_properties(idx).total_memory / (1024**3), 2) except Exception: info['available'] = False return info # ----------------------------- Threshold Optimization ----------------------------- # def optimize_threshold(metrics_json: Dict[str, Any], recall_target: float = 0.85): # We rely on best_threshold already saved; placeholder for constraint variant # If best threshold recall < target, we keep best; real implementation would search stored prob arrays return {'selected_threshold': metrics_json.get('logistic_regression', {}).get('best_threshold'), 'recall_target': recall_target} # ----------------------------- Trend Dashboard ----------------------------- # def build_dashboard(registry: Dict[str, Any]): rows = [] for run_id, meta in sorted(registry.items(), key=lambda x: x[1].get('timestamp','')): pr = meta.get('pr_auc') status = meta.get('status') rows.append(f"{run_id}{meta.get('timestamp')}{pr}{status}{meta.get('baseline')}") html = f"""Vector Stack Experiment Dashboard

Vector Stack Experiments

{''.join(rows)}
Run IDTimestampPR-AUCStatusBaseline
""" DASHBOARD_HTML.write_text(html) # ----------------------------- Change Impact Diff ----------------------------- # def compute_diff(previous_path: Optional[Path], current_hash: str) -> str: # For simplicity store last vector_stack.py hash; real diff already in VCS. if previous_path and previous_path.exists(): prev = previous_path.read_text().splitlines() else: prev = [] curr = VECTOR_STACK_PATH.read_text().splitlines() # Simple line-by-line diff summary (counts) added = sum(1 for l in curr if l not in prev) removed = sum(1 for l in prev if l not in curr) return f"Added lines (naive count): {added}, Removed lines (naive count): {removed}, current_hash={current_hash}" # ----------------------------- Sparse Feature Pruner (Placeholder) ----------------------------- # def sparse_feature_pruner(run_dir: Path) -> Dict[str, Any]: # Placeholder: would load coefficients if persisted. Return stub. return {'feature_mask_size': None, 'pruned': False} # ----------------------------- Data Drift Monitor ----------------------------- # def data_drift_monitor(run_dir: Path) -> Dict[str, Any]: # Use spans.json (if present) + y_train distribution spans_file = run_dir / 'data' / 'spans.json' y_train_file = run_dir / 'data' / 'X_train.npz' drift: Dict[str, Any] = {} if spans_file.exists(): drift['spans_present'] = True if y_train_file.exists(): try: import numpy as np # local import dat = np.load(y_train_file) y = dat['y'] drift['attack_rate'] = float(y.mean()) drift['n_train'] = int(y.shape[0]) except Exception as e: drift['error'] = str(e) return drift # ----------------------------- Auto Cleanup ----------------------------- # def auto_cleanup(keep_success: int = 5): if not RUN_BASE.exists(): return runs = sorted([p for p in RUN_BASE.iterdir() if p.is_dir()], key=lambda p: p.name) # Keep newest keep_success successes + all failures successes = [] for r in runs: meta_f = r / 'results' / 'metrics.json' if meta_f.exists(): successes.append(r) if len(successes) <= keep_success: return # Remove oldest extras (simple heuristic) for r in successes[:-keep_success]: try: shutil.rmtree(r) except Exception: pass # ----------------------------- Main Orchestration ----------------------------- # def run_experiment(args): RUN_BASE.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) ts = datetime.utcnow().strftime('%Y%m%d_%H%M%S') run_dir = RUN_BASE / ts run_dir.mkdir() # Config assembly config: Dict[str, Any] = { 'sw_num_angles': args.sw_angles, 'lr_penalty': args.lr_penalty, 'lr_max_iter': args.lr_max_iter, 'svm_max_iter': args.svm_max_iter, 'baseline_pr_auc': args.baseline_pr, } validate_topology_integrity(config) # Hash snapshot code_hash = sha256_file(VECTOR_STACK_PATH) extract_hash = sha256_file(EXTRACT_SCRIPT) snapshot = { 'vector_stack_hash': code_hash, 'extract_script_hash': extract_hash, 'config': config, } save_json(run_dir / 'snapshot.json', snapshot) # Skip if hash & config already in registry registry = load_registry() snapshot_id = hashlib.sha256(json.dumps(snapshot, sort_keys=True).encode()).hexdigest()[:16] if not args.force and snapshot_id in registry: print(f"[orchestrator] Snapshot {snapshot_id} already executed skipping. Use --force to re-run.") return run_dir, registry # Execute underlying extract script from ROOT so auto-detect can find manifests existing_dirs = set() vout_base = ROOT / 'validation' / 'vector_stack_outputs' if vout_base.exists(): existing_dirs = {p.name for p in vout_base.iterdir() if p.is_dir()} cmd = [sys.executable, str(EXTRACT_SCRIPT), '--sw-angles', str(args.sw_angles), '--lr-penalty', args.lr_penalty, '--lr-max-iter', str(args.lr_max_iter), '--svm-max-iter', str(args.svm_max_iter), '--baseline-pr', str(args.baseline_pr)] if args.skip_ablations: cmd.append('--skip-ablations') if args.no_calibration: cmd.append('--no-calibration') start = time.time() env = os.environ.copy() # Ensure project root importable so validation/extract_vector_stack.py can import 'src' env['PYTHONPATH'] = f"{ROOT}:{env.get('PYTHONPATH','')}" proc = subprocess.run(cmd, cwd=ROOT, capture_output=True, text=True, env=env) wall = time.time() - start (run_dir / 'raw_output').mkdir(exist_ok=True, parents=True) (run_dir / 'raw_output' / 'orchestrator_stdout.log').write_text(proc.stdout) (run_dir / 'raw_output' / 'orchestrator_stderr.log').write_text(proc.stderr) # Locate new output directory new_dir = None if vout_base.exists(): for p in vout_base.iterdir(): if p.is_dir() and p.name not in existing_dirs: new_dir = p break if new_dir is None: print('[orchestrator] Could not locate new vector_stack_outputs directory; aborting artifact harvest.') else: # Copy selected subfolders into run_dir for standard layout for sub in ['results', 'plots', 'raw_output', 'data']: src = new_dir / sub if src.exists(): dest = run_dir / sub if dest.exists(): shutil.rmtree(dest) shutil.copytree(src, dest) metrics_path = run_dir / 'results' / 'metrics.json' if not metrics_path.exists(): print('[orchestrator] metrics.json missing run failed.') return run_dir, registry metrics = load_json(metrics_path, {}) # Use best model PR-AUC (max across models) pr_vals = [m.get('pr_auc') for m in metrics.values() if isinstance(m, dict) and 'pr_auc' in m] best_pr = max(pr_vals) if pr_vals else None status = None if best_pr is not None: status = classify_run(best_pr, args.baseline_pr) missing = check_artifacts(run_dir) # Failure logging if status in {'FAILURE','WARNING','REGRESSION'}: FAILURE_LOG.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True) with open(FAILURE_LOG, 'a') as f: f.write(textwrap.dedent(f""" ## {datetime.utcnow().isoformat()}Z Run: {run_dir.name} Status: {status} Best PR-AUC: {best_pr} Baseline: {args.baseline_pr} Missing Artifacts: {missing} Snapshot ID: {snapshot_id} """)) # GPU probe & save gpu_info = gpu_probe() save_json(run_dir / 'results' / 'gpu_probe.json', gpu_info) # Threshold optimization placeholder save_json(run_dir / 'results' / 'threshold_optimization.json', optimize_threshold(metrics, recall_target=args.recall_target)) # Drift monitor save_json(run_dir / 'results' / 'data_drift.json', data_drift_monitor(run_dir)) # Sparse pruning placeholder save_json(run_dir / 'results' / 'sparse_pruning.json', sparse_feature_pruner(run_dir)) # Record registry entry registry[snapshot_id] = { 'run_dir': run_dir.name, 'timestamp': ts, 'pr_auc': best_pr, 'status': status, 'baseline': args.baseline_pr, 'wall_time_sec': wall, 'missing_artifacts': missing, } update_registry(registry) # Build dashboard build_dashboard(registry) # Change impact diff (using stored last hash file if exists) prev_hash_path = RUN_BASE / 'last_vector_stack_hash.txt' diff_summary = compute_diff(prev_hash_path if prev_hash_path.exists() else None, code_hash) (run_dir / 'results' / 'change_diff.txt').write_text(diff_summary) prev_hash_path.write_text(VECTOR_STACK_PATH.read_text()) # Generate repro script repro = f"#!/bin/bash\nset -euo pipefail\ncd $(dirname $0)\npython {EXTRACT_SCRIPT.relative_to(ROOT)} --sw-angles {args.sw_angles} --lr-penalty {args.lr_penalty} --lr-max-iter {args.lr_max_iter} --svm-max-iter {args.svm_max_iter} --baseline-pr {args.baseline_pr}\n" (run_dir / 'reproduce.sh').write_text(repro) # Default to non-executable (owner/group/world read) for security; user can chmod +x manually if executing directly os.chmod(run_dir / 'reproduce.sh', 0o644) # Auto cleanup auto_cleanup() summary = { 'run_dir': str(run_dir), 'best_pr_auc': best_pr, 'status': status, 'missing_artifacts': missing, 'snapshot_id': snapshot_id, 'gpu': gpu_info, } save_json(run_dir / 'results' / 'orchestrator_summary.json', summary) print(json.dumps(summary, indent=2)) return run_dir, registry # ----------------------------- CLI ----------------------------- # def parse_args(): p = argparse.ArgumentParser() p.add_argument('--sw-angles', type=int, default=48) p.add_argument('--lr-penalty', choices=['l1','l2'], default='l1') p.add_argument('--lr-max-iter', type=int, default=8000) p.add_argument('--svm-max-iter', type=int, default=8000) p.add_argument('--baseline-pr', type=float, default=0.706) p.add_argument('--skip-ablations', action='store_true') p.add_argument('--no-calibration', action='store_true') p.add_argument('--force', action='store_true', help='Force re-run even if snapshot seen') p.add_argument('--recall-target', type=float, default=0.85) return p.parse_args() if __name__ == '__main__': args = parse_args() run_experiment(args)
